column3: Lonwoerd would have you reaffirm your desire to join the Rogues' Guild.
Lonwoerd suggests that you meet with the master of the Rogues' Guild. Head inside and speak with Jacke.

After listening to Jacke's explanation of \xe2\x80\x9cthe job,\xe2\x80\x9d you convince the guildmaster that you're willing to embrace the shadowy life of a rogue. Equip the weathered daggers, and speak with Jacke once more.
I didn't scare you off, then? Bene. They told me ye was a mettlesome \x02\x08\x0f\xe9\x05\xff\x05lass\xff\x05cove\x03, an' so it's proved.
Ye'll need every onze o' that mettle soon enough. Now step inside an' have a prattle with Jacke. He's our Upright Man\xe2\x94\x80the master o' the guild.
You may now freely enter the Rogues' Guild. Speak with Lonwoerd whenever you wish to gain admittance to the guild's headquarters.

Aye, I'm the one they call \xe2\x80\x9cJacke\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x94\x80though I'm surprised ye've heard o' me. Perhaps ye'd be good enough to tell me \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03yer\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 name...along with that o' the kindly cove as told ye mine?
Ahhh! The famous \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03! Ol' Lonny Left-patch let you in, did he?
Hmmm... He can't throw a blade for shite, but that one eye don't miss naught when it comes to sizin' up a dimber \x02\x08\x0f\xe9\x05\xff\x05mort\xff\x05colt\x03 for the stallin'.
Just one thing... You ain't a pirate, are ye?
Well, then, it's time ye was stalled to the rogue! Pull on yer best beater cases an' I'll swear ye in meself when yer ready.

Now, I could fill yer wattles with the storied history of our guild, but that's just whids an' wind. The most important thing\xe2\x94\x80the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03only\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 thing\xe2\x94\x80we care about is gettin' the job done.
Now, most folk, an' I'm assumin' yer among 'em, know that not long after Limsa's foundin', the city was overrun by a motley collection o' pirates an' thieves.
But as wild as that lot were, it soon became clear that they'd all end up killin' each other if they didn't lay down a few rules\xe2\x94\x80an unspoken code o' conduct, as it were.

One, ye don't bite the purses o' yer fellow Lominsans; two, ye don't rook a crew out o' their spoils; an' three, ye don't trade culls like they was chattel. I'll admit the finer points o' the code are a mite murky, but most agree on those three, at least.

Now, ye might be thinkin' none o' that amounts to a sack o' dilberries now the Admiral's outlawed piracy, but in the back alleys an' black markets where Merlwy's grip ain't so tight, the code's still alive an' well.
An' just as the law is enforced by the Yellowjackets, the code is regulated by us rogues.

We go where the shadows are darkest, an' hand out justice to them as break the code. Some rum-soaked cove steals goods from the wrong cull, an' we steal 'em back. That's the job, my natty \x02\x08\x0e\xe9\x05\xff\x05lass\xff\x04lad\x03.
'Course, we don't hop the twig when bladework's called for, neither.

Ye'll see there's more to our daggerplay than just stickin' culls with the pointy end. We'll weaken a mark with poison, fade away an' strike in the darkmans\xe2\x94\x80whatever it takes to get the work done.
Well, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03? What do ye say to that? Got the guts to do a rogue's job?
bx02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Do\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 you have the guts to do a rogue's job?"
All right, then! First off, we'll have to get yer kit sorted out.

A rogue needs to be light on \x02\x08\r\xe9\x05\xff\x04her\xff\x04his\x03 dew beaters to stay on a mark's trail. The job might have ye fightin' across a deck or weavin' through a mob, an' the last thing ye want is a bleedin' great battleaxe what hooks itself on every rope an' post.
That's why we stick to daggers\xe2\x94\x80they let ye slip through the streets just as easily as they slip through a rook's ribs.

Here, take these stabbers an' let's see how they look on ye. ...Just don't get so excited with yer new toys that ye forget to dress for the role. Ye'd be surprised at how many colts come back to me in their bloody smallclothes...
A pity, but it's your choice to make, \x02\x08\x0e\xe9\x05\xff\x05lass\xff\x04lad\x03. The life of a rogue ain't for the pigeon-livered.
